meanings.definition: Knotty, twisted, and misshapen, especially due to age or weathering.
meanings.sent1: The gnarled tree branches reached out like twisted fingers.
meanings.sent2: The old man's hands were gnarled from years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The gnarled roots of the tree seemed to play a game of Twister underground.
meanings.sent4: Her gnarled walking stick was a testament to the many miles she had traveled.
meanings.sent5: The gnarled bark of the tree looked like a map of its long history.

meanings.definition: Having a rugged and rough appearance.
meanings.sent1: The gnarled rocks along the shore made walking difficult.
meanings.sent2: His face bore the marks of a gnarled life at sea.
meanings.sent3: The gnarled surface of the table felt like sandpaper to the touch.
meanings.sent4: The gnarled terrain of the mountain made the climb treacherous.
meanings.sent5: The gnarled texture of the fabric reminded her of the rough journey ahead.
